question: When a bar magnet is pushed towards the coil, along its axis, as shown in the figure, the galvanometer pointer deflects towards X. When this magnet is pulled away from the coil, the galvanometer pointer
images/e7f8a9b0-c1d2-4e3f-4a5b-6c7d8e9f0a1b.png
explanation: According to Lenz's Law, the induced current opposes the change in flux.
Pushing towards creates a certain flux change direction (deflection X).
Pulling away creates the opposite flux change, so the current direction reverses, deflecting towards X'.
